texto: Space exploration has changed significantly since the moon landing in 1969. Today, private companies like SpaceX and Blue Origin are developing technology to take tourists into space. In the future, scientists hope to build a human colony on Mars. This will be a huge challenge because Mars has a thin atmosphere and no liquid water on the surface. We will need to invent new ways to grow food and produce oxygen. Many people believe that space travel is the only way to save humanity if Earth becomes uninhabitable.

texto: The Industrial Revolution started in Great Britain in the late 18th century. It was a period of great transformation. Machines replaced hand tools, and factories replaced small workshops. The invention of the steam engine by James Watt was a turning point because it allowed trains and ships to travel much faster. However, life wasn't easy for the workers. Many people moved from the countryside to the cities to work in factories, often in dangerous conditions. This period created the modern world we live in today.

opciones: They moved to cities to work in factories

texto: Plastic is everywhere: in our clothes, our kitchen, and even our electronics. It is very useful, but it is also a huge problem for the environment. Millions of tons of plastic end up in the oceans every year, killing sea animals like turtles and whales. Scientists have discovered 'microplastics' even in our food and water. We must reduce the use of single-use plastics, like straws and bags, and improve recycling systems. If we don't act now, there will be more plastic than fish in the sea by 2050.

opciones: Yes, we must improve recycling systems

texto: Malala Yousafzai was born in Pakistan in 1997. She is a famous activist for female education. When she was a teenager, the Taliban banned girls from going to school in her region. Malala decided to write a blog about her life and fight for her rights. In 2012, she survived a dangerous attack and moved to the UK. In 2014, at the age of 17, she became the youngest person ever to receive the Nobel Peace Prize. Today, she continues to travel the world to ensure that every girl can go to school.

texto: Health is not only about exercising and eating vegetables; mental health is equally important. In our stressful modern world, many teenagers suffer from anxiety or depression because of school exams or social media pressure. To feel better, it is important to talk to someone you trust, like a friend or a teacher. Taking breaks from screens, meditating, and sleeping enough also help our brain to stay healthy. Remember, it's okay not to be okay sometimes, but you shouldn't be alone.

opciones: No, mental health is also important

preguntas.pregunta: Why do many teenagers suffer from anxiety?

opciones: Taking breaks from screens and sleeping enough

preguntas.pregunta: What is the final message of the text?
opciones: It's okay not to be okay, but speak up

texto: Stonehenge is a prehistoric monument in England. It consists of a ring of standing stones, each around 4 meters high. It was built between 3000 BC and 2000 BC. But how did Neolithic people move such heavy stones without modern technology? And why did they build it? Some archaeologists believe it was a temple, others think it was an astronomical calendar to track the sun and the moon. Today, Stonehenge is one of the most famous places in the world and a UNESCO Heritage site.

opciones: How people moved heavy stones without technology

texto: In the digital age, information travels very fast. However, not all news on the internet is true. 'Fake news' are false stories that people share on social media to manipulate opinions or to get clicks. To be a good digital citizen, you should check the source of the information before sharing it. Ask yourself: Who wrote this? Does the headline sound too dramatic? Are there other websites reporting the same news? Critical thinking is our best weapon against lies in the online world.

preguntas.pregunta: What should a good digital citizen do?

opciones: A headline that sounds too dramatic

preguntas.pregunta: What is our best weapon against online lies?

opciones: To manipulate opinions or get money / clicks

texto: St. Patrick's Day is celebrated on March 17th. It is the national day of Ireland, but it is now celebrated all over the world. People wear green clothes and shamrocks (small plants with three leaves). In many cities, there are large parades with music and dancing. Why is everything green? Legend says that St. Patrick used the shamrock to explain the Holy Trinity and that green makes you invisible to leprechauns. In some places, they even dye the river water green to celebrate this day!

opciones: A small plant with three leaves

texto: Imagine that your fridge can tell you when you need more milk, or your coffee machine starts working automatically when your alarm clock rings. This is the Internet of Things (IoT). It is a network of physical objects connected to the internet. This technology makes our lives easier and more efficient. However, it also has risks. If everything is connected, hackers could try to control our homes. We need to be careful with cybersecurity to protect our privacy while enjoying these modern inventions.

opciones: It makes life easier and more efficient

preguntas.pregunta: What is a risk of IoT?

texto: Black holes are one of the most mysterious and powerful things in the universe. A black hole is a region in space where gravity is so strong that nothing, not even light, can escape from it. They are formed when a very large star dies and collapses. Scientists cannot see black holes directly because they are invisible, but they can see how they affect the stars and gas around them. Recently, scientists have even taken the first photo of a black hole! There is still a lot to learn about these cosmic monsters.

opciones: A region in space with extremely strong gravity

opciones: They took the first photo of a black hole
